network

Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.Network

  • public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    The Network class first of all serves as a network representation constituted of sets of Nodes, Edges and OD (Origin-Destination) pairs. Second of all, it contains methods meant to perform operations to illustrate the network, update edge LoS, perform all-or-nothing assignment, print network information to files, and more.

    As a rule of thumb, methods that represent algorithms beyond basic ones such as Dijkstra's algorithm, should not be contained in this class, but rather in a different model object, such as the RSUET, which is an extension of the abstract class RouteChoiceModel.

    Author:
    mesch
    See Also:
    Edge, Node, OD, RouteChoiceModel

    • Field Detail

      • nodes

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Node> nodes
        This hashmap indexes the set of network nodes by their integer ID.

      • edges

        private Edge[] edges
        Set of edges, implemented as an array. This structure requires that edges be indexed from 1 to N, where N is the number of edges in the network. Could easily, and probably should, be implemented as a HashMap.

        Is now made redundant with edgesNodePair; should be deprecated and phased out.

        See Also:
        getNode(int), edgesNodePair

      • edgesNodePair

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Edge>> edgesNodePair
        Edges identified by their tail and head, which is not only preferable to having a dedicated set of edge indices, but also more computationally efficient when recalling an edge from node i to j, and more convenient. Should replace edges completely.
        See Also:
        edges

      • ods

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,OD>> ods
        Set of Origin-destination relations, so that ods.get(i).get(j) gets the OD that goes from node i to j.

      • M

        private double M
        Deprecated. 
        "general" big-M, but it is cleaner to implement this as a local variable in each algorithm.

      • isUniversalChoiceSetGenerated

        private boolean isUniversalChoiceSetGenerated
        The design intent is that this keeps track of when the universal choice set is correctly stored in OD.R, but is is clumsy and should maybe be implemented differently.

      • numOD

        private int numOD

    • Constructor Detail

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.String folderName)
        Very important constructor. This does not only read the network data, it also pre-processes the network. The current implementation is robust, but also inefficient, which can be a slight nuisance when reading large networks from virtual drives, since there are so many data that occur during file read. Reading from a duplicate local folder should improve performance significantly.
        Parameters:
        folderName - the name of the folder to which to write the output file

    • Method Detail

      • addPathToR

        private void addPathToR(OD od,
                        int[] newNodeSeq)
        Constructs a new path object and adds it to the universal choice set.
        Parameters:
        od - the OD relation of the path to be added
        newNodeSeq - the node sequence of the path to be added as an array of integers
        See Also:
        generateUniversalChoiceSet()

      • allOrNothing

        public void allOrNothing()
        Performs an all-or-nothing assignment using the current path costs, as defined by Path.genCost. This also adds the shortest paths to the restricted choice sets of the appropriate OD-relation, OD.restrictedChoiceSet. This is an important detail to keep in mind when using this in an algorithm such as the RSUET; if the behavior is unwanted, the paths can simply be overwritten by re-initializing the restricted choice sets as empty ArrayList after calling this method.

        Also keep in mind that the all-or-nothing assignment does NOT include network loading -- the paths are only assigned flow, but loaded onto the network. This should be achieved by manually calling loadNetwork().

      • calculateAvgChoiceSetSize

        public double calculateAvgChoiceSetSize()
        Calculates the average size of the restricted choice sets, weighting each OD-relation equally. The size of each choice set is the number of saved paths which have a flow of strictly more than 0.
        Returns:
        the average restricted choice set size.

      • calculateNumOd

        public int calculateNumOd()
        Calculates the number of OD-relations in the network, meaning those where demand is above 0; this corresponds to the number of objects in ods.
        Returns:
        the number of OD-relations

      • calculateTotalDemand

        public double calculateTotalDemand()
        Calculates the sum of demand over OD-relations on the network.
        Returns:
        the total demand

      • columnGeneration

        public boolean columnGeneration()
        For each OD, finds the shortest path and adds it to the restricted chocie set if it is not already part of it.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • cutUniversalChoiceSets

        public void cutUniversalChoiceSets(double maximumCostRatio)
        The universal choice set usually includes many irrelevant paths. To increase computational performance, these may be excluded by defining some cost above which paths will be removed, hoping that all relevant routes are still considered.

        This method cuts off all paths from the universal choice set which have a cost equal to or greater than maximumCostRatio times the shortest path cost at the time of the method call.

        Parameters:
        maximumCostRatio - the factor so that paths od.R where maximumCostRatio * od.getMinimumCost() >= path.genCost are removed.

      • dijkstraMinPriorityQueue

        public boolean dijkstraMinPriorityQueue(Node originNode)
        An efficient implementation of the dijkstra algorithm using a augmented min-priority queue with a mapped binary heap. Also includes early termination, i.e. when all destinations from the node have been solved, the algorithm stops. Uses relatively a lot of memory, but this is usually a minor issue.
        Parameters:
        originNode - the node from which to find the shortest path to all destinations with demand from the node.
        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise

      • draw

        public void draw(int type,
                 int canvasSize)
        Draws this network with StdDraw using Node coordinates.
        Parameters:
        type - determines which labels are applied to the edges:
        • type = 0: Free flow time.
        • type = 1: Congested time (total time).
        • type = 2: Ratio of total time to free flow time.
        • type = 3: Flow.
        • type = 4: Free flow time / total time.
        canvasSize - the size of the square drawing, measured in pixels

        Parameters:

        to - to node
        circleRadius - radius of the line used
        type - integer specifying the label type, see draw(int, int)

      • drawPath

        public void drawPath(Path path,
                     int type,
                     double circleRadius)
        Highlights a set of edges on a canvas after a call of draw(int, int).
        Parameters:
        path - the path to highlight
        type - determines which labels are applied to the edges:
        • type = 0: Free flow time.
        • type = 1: Congested time (total time).
        • type = 2: Ratio of total time to free flow time.
        • type = 3: Flow.
        • type = 4: Free flow time / total time.
        circleRadius - the radius to which the line thickness is scaled.

      • generateUniversalChoiceSet

        public void generateUniversalChoiceSet()
        Fills out the universal choice sets (acyclic routes only) by calling the recursive function minos for all OD relations. This is done by brute force; not that the problem is inherently NP-hard and has a non-polynomial complexity. This means that the user should not expect this method to function on even medium-size networks.

      • getEdge

        public Edge getEdge(int edgeID)
        Gets an edge by its single integer ID; this method should be phased out in favour of strictly adhering to the structure of edgesNodePair, where edges are identified by head- and tail nodes.
        Parameters:
        edgeID - The single integer ID of the edge; this is implicitly specified by the order in which edges are read from the _net.tntp file.
        Returns:
        the edge with ID edgeID.

      • getEdge

        public Edge getEdge(int tail,
                    int head)
        This is the preferred way of recalling edges, replacing getEdge(int). This operation is O(1).
        Parameters:
        tail - the integer ID of the node from which the edge originates.
        head - the integer ID of the node at which the edge terminates
        Returns:
        the edge

      • getEdge

        public Edge getEdge(Node tail,
                    Node head)
        This another acceptable way of recalling edges, replacing getEdge(int); slightly faster is the mapping by integer ID, see getEdge(int, int). This operation is O(1).
        Parameters:
        tail - the integer ID of the node from which the edge originates.
        head - the integer ID of the node at which the edge terminates
        Returns:
        the edge
        See Also:
        getEdge(int, int)

      • getNode

        public Node getNode(int nodeID)
        The preferred way of recalling the node with ID nodeID. This operation is O(1).
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the integer ID of the node to return
        Returns:
        the node with ID nodeID

      • initializeDijkstraMinPriorityQueue

        private void initializeDijkstraMinPriorityQueue(java.util.AbstractQueue<Node> Q,
                                                java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> Qbuddy,
                                                java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> destinations,
                                                int originNodeID,
                                                Node originNode)
        Inititialization of the Dijkstra algorithm for improved brevity and readability.
        Parameters:
        Q - the set of visited nodes as a priority queue; the shortest path to these nodes has been found.
        Qbuddy - identical to Q, but as a HashMap to regularly check what is in the queue
        destinations - HashSet of integers corresponding to the list of still unvisited destinations with demand
        originNodeID - integer ID of origin node
        originNode - origin as node

      • loadNetwork

        public void loadNetwork()
        Makes the flow on edges in the network correspond to the flow on paths in restricted choice sets.

        Network loading can take relatively quite a long time when the choice sets are large.

      • maxChoiceSetSize

        public int maxChoiceSetSize()
        Loops over restricted choice sets to determine the highest number of used routes in restricted choice sets.
        Returns:
        the size of the largest choice set

      • minChoiceSetSize

        public int minChoiceSetSize()
        Loops over restricted choice sets to determine the smallest number of used routes in restricted choice sets.
        Returns:
        the size of the smallest choice set

      • minos

        private void minos(OD od,
                   int u,
                   int[] currentPath,
                   boolean[] unvisited)
        The recursive algorithm that enumerates the universal choice set; its basic principle is that the universal choice set from A to B equals the union of the universal choice sets from the neighbours of A to B. To eliminate acyclic routes, recursive calls do not include already visited nodes. Finally, the base case is when B is a neighbor of A. See the algorithm implementation to better understand the concept if needed.
        Parameters:
        od - the OD the holds the destination to which to find all shortest path
        u - the ID of the node from which to find all shortest paths
        currentPath - the path which was taken to get to u from the origin in the OD
        unvisited - an array such that unvisited[i] is true if node i has not yet been visited

      • nodeSeqAsEdgeList

        private java.util.ArrayList<Edge> nodeSeqAsEdgeList(int[] nodeSeq)
        Takes in a sequence of integers corresponding to nodes and returns a list of edges corresponding to the pairs of nodes that occur in the series: in: node1|node2|node3 out: edge12 | edge23
        Parameters:
        nodeSeq - sequence of node IDs on the path
        Returns:
        an array list of edges corespondding to the passed node sequence

      • printChoiceSets

        public void printChoiceSets(java.io.File file)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Attempts to print to the File file the contents of the restricted choice sets for each OD. Output includes for each path:
        • Origin node
        • Destination node
        • Node sequence
        • Choice probability from last iteration
        • Flow
        • Total travel time on route
        Parameters:
        file - the file to write
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws an exception if the file was not found and could not be created.

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws an exception if the file coud not be written
        See Also:

      • printFlowSolution

        public void printFlowSolution(java.io.File file)
                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Attempts to print to the file file a list of link flows by edge ID. Also prints the link time. Uses the default delimiter ", ".
        Parameters:
        file - the file to write
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws an exception if the file could not be written

      • printFlowSolution

        public void printFlowSolution(java.io.File file,
                              java.lang.String delim)
                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Attempts to print to the file file a list of link flows by edge ID. Also prints the link time. Uses the specified delimiter delim
        Parameters:
        delim - the delimiter to use in the .csv file
        file - the .csv file to write (will be created if it does not exist)
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws an exception if the file could not be found and could not be created

      • printFlowSolution

        public void printFlowSolution(java.lang.String folderName)
        Print the flow solution in the same way as printFlowSolution(File), but without specifying the file name. Instead creates a file called "flow_" + timestamp, where timestamp has the format "yyy_MM-dd_HH_mm_ss".
        Parameters:
        folderName - the folder to create a timestamped output folder in

      • printOutput

        public void printOutput(java.lang.String folderName,
                        RSUET rcm,
                        ConvergencePattern conv)
        The preferred way to create output diagnostics. Calls printOutput with a time stamp as the folder name, and outputs to the folder:
        • Detailed information about all restricted choice sets (see printChoiceSets(File))
        • Aggregate information about restricted choice set composition: min, avg and max size (see printChoiceSetSummary(File)
        • Convergence pattern passed to this method (see ConvergencePattern.printToFile(File)
        • Flow solution (see printFlowSolution(File)
        • Parameters of the route choice model solution algorithm and RUM parameters
        Parameters:
        folderName - The name of an existing folder in which to create a new folder for the output.
        rcm - the instance of the RouteChoiceModel class whose parameters to print.
        conv - An instance of the ConvergencePattern to print.

      • printOutput

        public void printOutput(java.lang.String folderName,
                        RSUET rcm,
                        ConvergencePattern conv,
                        java.lang.String nameOfOutputFolder)
        Parameters:
        folderName - The name of an existing folder in which to create a new folder for the output.
        rcm - the instance of the RouteChoiceModel class whose parameters to print.
        conv - An instance of the ConvergencePattern to print.
        nameOfOutputFolder - Name of the output folder which is created.

      • readNetworkRaw

        private void readNetworkRaw(java.lang.String filename1,
                            java.lang.String filename2,
                            java.lang.String filename3)
        Read method which can read network triplets as they are formatted in https://github.com/bstabler/TransportationNetworks.
        Parameters:
        filename1 - [network]_net.tntp
        filename2 - [network]_node.tntp
        filename3 - [network]_trips.tntp
        See Also:
        Network(String)

      • relGapUsed

        public double relGapUsed()
        Calculates the gap measure on used routes (inner convergence measure) as defined by their transformed cost; corresponds to eq. (27) in Rasmussen et al, 2015, and generalized for the TSUE via the value returned by Path.computeTransformedCost(RouteChoiceModel).
        Returns:
        the relative used gap on the network

      • resetNetwork

        public void resetNetwork()
        Set all network edge flows to 0, and restricted choice sets to 0.

      • restrictedInnerMasterProblem

        public void restrictedInnerMasterProblem(RUM rum,
                                         double gamma)
        /** Important and common problem of assigning probabilities and auxiliary flows using the RUM when assuming given LoS as defined by state of the network object. Also updates flows on paths to oldFlow * (1-gamma) + auxiliaryFlow * (gamma).
        Parameters:
        rum - the random utility model to determine the choice probabilities.
        gamma - the relative trust in the auxiliary solution; gamma is between 0 and 1.

      • shortestPath

        private Path shortestPath(OD od)
        Uses the predecessors of each nodes found by a dijktra's algorithm to determine the shortest path from O to D. This method only works when dijkstra's algorithm was last called on node od.O.
        Parameters:
        od - the OD between which to find the shortest path based on the last dijkstra search performed on the origin.
        Returns:
        the shortest path from od.O to od.D.

      • sortUniversalChoiceSets

        public void sortUniversalChoiceSets()
        Sort the universal choice set by their natural ordering.
        See Also:
        Path.compareTo(Path)

      • testDemandIntegrity

        public OD testDemandIntegrity(double tolerance)
        Tests if the total flow assigned on paths in the restricted choice set for each OD is equal to the demand, with a tolerance of precision.
        Parameters:
        tolerance - the maximum allowed relative deviation from the demand to consider the assigned flow correct
        Returns:
        the first found OD where the sum of assigned flow on the restricted choice set does not equal the demand on the OD.

      • testDemandIntegrity

        private boolean testDemandIntegrity(OD od,
                                    double tolerance)
        Tests if the demand on a specific OD equals the sum of flows on routes in the restricted choice set on that OD.
        Parameters:
        od - the OD to be tested
        tolerance - the maximum allowed relative deviation from the demand
        Returns:
        true if the demand does not correspond to the assigned flow within the tolerance, false otherwise

      • throwNetworkReadExceptionFileNotFound

        private void throwNetworkReadExceptionFileNotFound(java.lang.String fileEnding)

      • unrestrictedMasterProblemInnerLogit

        public void unrestrictedMasterProblemInnerLogit(RUM rum,
                                                RefCostFun omega,
                                                double gamma)
        the unrestricted master problem, as opposed to the restricted one, does not assume that all routes in restrictedChoiceSet are used. Therefore it also requires a reference cost function to specify the threshold which defines if a route is used or not.
        Parameters:
        rum - the random utility model to be used to determine choice probabilities on used routes
        omega - the threshold reference cost function
        gamma - the relative trust in the auxiliary solution

      • updateEdgeCosts

        public void updateEdgeCosts(RUM rum)
        Updates the cost on edges to correspond to the current flows on them
        Parameters:
        rum - the RUM from which to extract the generalized cost (additive deterministic utility)

      • updatePathCosts

        public void updatePathCosts()
        Updates the generalized cost on paths to correspond to the sum of generalized costs of its edges. Also updates the minimum cost on each OD.

      • updatePathSizeFactors

        public void updatePathSizeFactors(RUM rum)
        Updates the Path Size Factors of all paths in restricted choice sets. Uses generalized costs to determine degree of similarity, which means that path size factors must be updated every time LoS in the network is updated.
        Parameters:
        rum - the Random Utility Model from which to retrieve the Path Size factor
        See Also:
        PSL

      • updatePathSizeFactorsWherePathsWereAdded

        public void updatePathSizeFactorsWherePathsWereAdded(RUM rum)
        To save computation time of the relatively expensive operation of re-updating path size factors after columnGeneration() in the RSUET(min,omega), this method only selectively them where a new path was introduced.
        Parameters:
        rum - the Random Utility Model from which to retrieve the Path Size factor
        See Also:
        RSUET.solve(Network)

      • updateTransformedCosts

        public void updateTransformedCosts(RouteChoiceModel rcm)
        Update the transformed costs on all paths in restricted choice sets, using the passed route choice model.
        Parameters:
        rcm - the route choice model from which to retrieve the transformed cost

      • updateUniversalChoiceSetCosts

        private void updateUniversalChoiceSetCosts()
        Updates generalized costs of the universal choice set for each OD to correspond to the sum of generalized costs of the edges that constitute them.

      • writeUniversalChoiceSet

        public void writeUniversalChoiceSet(java.lang.String filename)
        Writes the universal choice set; requires it to be generated.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to output to, as a string
        See Also:
        generateUniversalChoiceSet()
